code.description: The code related to override message.

responseCode.description: The user input to accept/reject the override.

batchStage.description: User can group the processes into four distinct stages.   The first character is used to define the stage, which must be one of the following:  A: Application  D: Start of Day  R: Reporting  S: System  O: Online Within the batch control system, each stage verifies that all the processes in the previous stage have completed successfully before continuing.  The remaining 3 characters are process sequence number. Modifications to the sequence number should adhere to the following guidelines: Range 000 to 099: should not be modified. Range 100 to 899: only the last two digits should be modified. Range 900 - 999: should not be modified. If no sequence number (process dependency) has been appended to the batch stage, then this process can be run concurrently within the stage. However if a sequence number (e.g. A009) has been specified then the process can be run only when all other processes with sequence numbers lower than this have completed successfully. Processes with the same sequence number can be run concurrently.

batchEnvironment.description: Environment where the process run.  Allowed values: F: Foreground - Run directly on the user's terminal. B: Background - Run as a background task.

verificationJobId.description: Contains the verification job identifier.Typically used to control whether a job is completed before the current jobId is executed.

jobFrequency.description: Contains the frequency on which the job is next processed. POSSIBLE VALUES:- D: Every working day. Dnn: Every nn'th working day. W: Weekly every Friday. - M: Last working day of every month. - Mnn: nn represents the offset added to the first day of every month to arrive at Next Run date. When the resultant date is a holiday, previous Working day is considered.

nextRunDate.description: Contains bank date on which the job is to be next run

data.description: Contains any input parameters/data required for the job

userId.description: The user name to be loaded for reporting jobs during Close of Business If no user name is entered in this field then the default profile for the user 'operator' is used.

recordStatus.description: General status of the record. Possible values: - null - authorised - IHLD - input, on hold - INAU - input, not authorised - INA2 - input, authorised, pending second authorisation - INAO - input, not authorised with blocking overrides - RNAU - reversed, not authorised - RNAO - reversed, not authorised with blocking overrides

currNo.description: Indicates the number of times a record has been modified

inputter.description: The user identifier who input the transaction

authoriser.description: This indicates the user who authorized the transaction.

companyId.description: The identifier of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch.

deptCode.description: The department code where the transaction was authorized.

auditTimeDate.description: Reference to the audit date and time.

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

uniqueIdentifier.description: The unique identifier/Message Reference of the record created.

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

The remaining 3 characters are process sequence number. Modifications to the sequence number should adhere to the following guidelines: Range 000 to 099: should not be modified. Range 100 to 899: only the last two digits should be modified. Range 900 - 999: should not be modified. If no sequence number (process dependency) has been appended to the batch stage, then this process can be run concurrently within the stage. However if a sequence number (e.g. A009) has been specified then the process can be run only when all other processes with sequence numbers lower than this have completed successfully. Processes with the same sequence number can be run concurrently.

When the resultant date is a holiday, previous Working day is considered.

code.description: The code related to override message.

code.description: The identifier of the error message
The identifier of the error message

message.description: The actual t24 error message for bad requests

type.description: The identifier of error type: Business

code.description: The identifier of the error message

message.description: The actual t24 error message caused by server

type.description: The identifier of error type: System

jobProfileId.description: Reference to the record in workload profiles for services. Every Service can be attached to multiple workload profiles where the number of agents to use will be defined. The profile specified here will be used to run the service on the server name specified in the associated multi value set. Default Value: If this field is left blank then the workload profiles for services record with DEFAULT as the ID will be picked up. If Profile record is not found, get number of agents from 'System Parameter File' record

serverName.description: Contains the name of the Server on which the service will run.

jobServerStatus.description: Contains the Status of Server. POSSIBLE VALUES: ACTIVE: To set the server as active INACTIVE: To set the server as inactive

serviceDescription.description: Contains the description of the Service

userId.description: The user name to be loaded for reporting jobs during Close of Business If no user name is entered in this field then the default profile for the user 'operator' is used.

jobOperation.description: The control which user be exercise upon the current service.   Allowed values: - START: to start the current service.  - STOP: to stop the current service - AUTO: to start the current service automatically and stop at the end of the process.

recordStatus.description: General status of the record. Possible values: - null - authorised - IHLD - input, on hold - INAU - input, not authorised - INA2 - input, authorised, pending second authorisation - INAO - input, not authorised with blocking overrides - RNAU - reversed, not authorised - RNAO - reversed, not authorised with blocking overrides
